chargeHist.descr: 1st Degree Child Sex Assault - Sexual Contact with Person under Age of 13

result.execSummary:
The defendant Pedro S. Esquivias was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Pedro S. Esquivias is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Pedro S. Esquivias was found guilty of Lewd, Lascivious Behavior-In Public, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 944.20(1)(a).
  • Pedro S. Esquivias was found guilty of Lewd, Lascivious Behavior-In Public, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 944.20(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Cover Letter from DOC agent
Cover Letter from Atty. Hoffman

Defendant Pedro S. Esquivias in court with attorney Andrew I. Martinez.  Linda A. Hoffman appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Amended complaint provided to the court. Atty Martinez received amended complaint and waives reading. No contest Plea entered count 3 and count 4. plea accepted by Court. Court finds Defendant guilty. Court withholds sentence.

Count 1: Dismissed

Count 2: Dismissed

Count 3 and Count 4: (Joint recommendation and order)

24 months Probation/report by 3:30 today
DNA sample
Undergo any counseling per agent
$443.00 fine or costs on each count , 60 days to pay or set up a payment plan
Conditions of Probation:
Provide DNA sample.  Undergo any counseling/treatment per agent

Defendant Pedro S. Esquivias in court with attorney Stanley V. Woodard.  Sue Mueller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court states case and State states appearances.  Atty Woodard acknowledges rec. information, waives reading and stands mute.  Court enters Not Guilty plea- Set for Trial.  Bond continued.
Arraignment on September 19, 2014 at 01:00 pm.

Defendant Pedro S. Esquivias in court with attorney Stanley V. Woodard.  Sue Mueller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Atty Woodard states DE will waive right to prelim today.  DE agrees.  Court questions DE on waiver/accepts/finds probable cause and binds over.  State requests 30 days to do arraignment.  Atty Woodard requests plea/sent as it will be a misd. plea.  Bond continued.  Time limits cont'd waived.  Arraignment scheduled for September 19, 2014 at 01:00 pm.
Return date on August 19, 2014 at 01:00 pm.
Return date on August 12, 2014 at 01:00 pm.

Pre-trial conference on July 18, 2014 at 10:15 am.
Return date on July 31, 2014 at 01:00 pm.

Defendant Pedro S. Esquivias appeared by video means with Attorney ORourke. Prosecuting Atty Sue M Mueller appeared for State of Wisconsin.  Defendant waives reading of complaint.  Defendant does not reside locally.  Aged warrants.  State request $1000 cash bond w/ conditions.  Attorney ORourke request signature bond.  Defendant is employed.  Request his own female child to be exempt from conditons.  Advised rights to an attorney.  Time limits waived. $1000.00 CASH bond set.  Special bond conditions as follows:  No unsupervised contact with females under age 18 years, except defendant's own child.  No contact with waterparks.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for July 18, 2014 at 10:15 am.  Return date scheduled for July 31, 2014 at 01:00 pm.
